name: LOST CINDERS
description:
In a world where ice has taken over, a lost flame must descend into the depths of the glacial queens' lair to atone for an ancient sin forgotten by people. 

   

  • Single-player platformer game focusing on Jump' n' Run.
  • Responsive controls for fluid gameplay.
  • A moving story filled with riddles and wonders.
  • Tearful music supporting the chilling aesthetic.

  

My name is Sam and I am a game development student at the HTK Academy. I created LOST CINDERS in a span of six months using everything I have learned throughout my first semester at the academy. The game was made using the Unity engine.

Run:

  • Right arrow (Keyboard)
  • Left arrow (Keyboard)
  • Right stick (Gamepad)

Jump:

  • Space bar (Keyboard)
  • Button south (Gamepad)

Attack:

  • Q/K (Keyboard)
  • Button west (Gamepad)

Look up/ Look down:

  • Up arrow (Keyboard)
  • Down arrow (Keyboard)
  • Right Stick up (Gamepad)
  • Right Stick down (Gamepad)

Interact:

  • E (Keyboard)
  • Button North (Gamepad)

Pause: 

  • Escape/P (Keyboard)
  • Options (Gamepad)

I would like to my lecturers for teaching me everything I needed to know to make this game a reality.  Special thanks go to Earthlord23 for helping me out with my code, Znowy for giving me artistic and emotional support, and ToastedGears for tips on my sprites and animations.  Additionally, thank Jonathan Shaw for producing beautiful soundtracks for people like me to use for free in our games.  I would lastly like to thank my mental stability for enduring the stress of the last six months.
